job description:
Process Development Associate Scientist

-Technical support of bioreactor operations and pre-culture activities in development of bioreactor processes for current products.

- Conduct bioreactor and small-scale cell culture experiments in support of those activities.

- Be familiar with basic laboratory techniques, including but not limited to: aseptic expansion of mammalian cell culture and routine analytical procedures on cell culture samples.

- Have good understanding of cell culture parameters in general (cell growth rate, cell density, viability, population doubling, metabolites and cell waste, etc.).

- Be responsible for daily monitoring of the cell culture and keeping thorough record of cell culture parameters and results into data sheets and/or electronic notebooks.

- Responsible for data integrity and accuracy. T

- Experience with aseptic techniques, cell culture in shake flasks, Wave bioreactors and small bioreactors, and cell counting methods and equipment (Cedex) is preferred.

Masters degree or Bachelors degree and 2 years of directly related experience

Competencies

- Strong computer, scientific, and organizational skills.

- Excellent communication (oral and written) and attention to detail.

- Working knowledge of analytical methodologies and analytical instruments qualification programs. Excellent computer technical writing skills.
